rows.title: Before your session, discuss with your co-facilitator

title.eng: Before your session, discuss with your co-facilitator

text.eng:
1. Read the module for the session carefully and make sure you are clear about the objectives for your discussion.

2. Write down notes that will help you conduct the session.

3. It may be helpful to write down different ways of asking questions to participants. T

4. You can also practice conducting or discussing some parts of the session with your co-facilitator!

5. Decide who among you and the co-facilitator will lead the activities and who will provide support.

6. Review each participant's documents to see their progress in the program and to note who needs additional support. 

7. Divide the time according to the needs of the group. 

8. Arrive early to prepare the space to be used.

rows.text:
1. Read the module for the session carefully and make sure you are clear about the objectives for your discussion.

2. Write down notes that will help you conduct the session.

3. It may be helpful to write down different ways of asking questions to participants. T

4. You can also practice conducting or discussing some parts of the session with your co-facilitator!

5. Decide who among you and the co-facilitator will lead the activities and who will provide support.

6. Review each participant's documents to see their progress in the program and to note who needs additional support. 

7. Divide the time according to the needs of the group. 

8. Arrive early to prepare the space to be used.

rows.title: Materials required for the session

text.eng:
**The materials listed should be sufficient for 15 participants**

Pencils, bond paper, ballpoint pen, pentel pen, scotch tape, name tags

Comic posters and handouts


Snack for the break

**Other materials are for the whole group**

Flipchart for participants' ideas

Video camera if you will be recording the session

Some things that MaPa Staff will determine are:

Reimbursement for transportation, attendance list, and other forms required by MaPa

extra_text.eng: Flashcards (6 pieces for parents) or Projector + Section 2.1

rows.title: Review the chat

text.eng:
1️⃣ Review the messages from the previous module. Take note of parents who may need additional support.

2️⃣ Review the feedback from the previous module. Select a success that can be linked to the foundations in the live chat.

3️⃣ Choose a challenge that the group can work together to solve in the live chat.

rows.title: Outline for Day One

text.eng:
1 – Greetings & Welcome
2 – Discussion: Burial Work
3 – Sharing Success
4 – Sharing the Challenge
5 – Discussion: Challenges & Solutions
6 – Introducing MaPa Skill: Talking About Feelings
7 – Comics: Conversation About Feelings (Children)
8 – Discussion About Comics
9 – Comics: Talking About Feelings (Teenage Son)
10 – Discussion About Comics
11 – Discussion: Considering the Child’s Age in Conversations
12 – Discussion: Reasons for Talking About Feelings
13 – Setting a Home Activity or Homework
14 – Clarification Video: MaPa Skill Reminder
15 – Audio Reminder: Pause for a Moment
16 – Gratitude & Closing
